title: The Second Seal
description: The first seal was just a warning. The creature's thrashing has severed the second seal beneath the abandoned Sunken Rails. You must investigate the damage.

turns.narrative: The Sunken Rails are filled with waist-deep toxic sludge. The mutated remains of the original rail workers attack you.
turns.choice_a: Use a wide-swinging sweep attack to clear them
turns.consequence_a: You clear them easily, but the wide swing damages the fragile ancient support columns of the tunnel.
turns.consequence_b: A slower fight, but you preserve the tunnel's structural integrity.

turns.narrative: You reach the Second Seal. It is utterly pulverized. A massive, tentacled appendage is blindly thrashing through the hole in the bedrock.
turns.choice_a: Strike the tentacle to force it back down
turns.consequence_a: You sever the tentacle. The massive beast below roars, causing a localized earthquake, but retracts its limb.
turns.choice_b: Throw an incendiary down the hole
turns.consequence_b: The beast screams and thrashes harder, widening the hole significantly before retreating.

tentacle_severed.description: You severed the beast's limb, forcing a retreat.

hole_widened.description: You burned the beast, but structurally weakened its prison.

conclusion: You severed the beast's limb, forcing a retreat.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.
